Btw do you know what Obnoxious means? Or you just throw it here cause you heard it alot of times on boards whenever someone tried to devalue others arguments/opinions?

Here:

> Obnoxious
1. highly objectionable or offensive; odious:
obnoxious behavior.
2. annoying or objectionable due to being a showoff or attracting undue attention to oneself:
an obnoxious little brat.
3. Archaic. exposed or liable to harm, evil, or anything objectionable.
4. Obsolete. liable to punishment or censure; reprehensible.
That AOE poison be showing off, gurl. Better watch out: it's got some Gucci heels, a fake tan, and an attitude that will make Kim Kardashian look like a humble and sweet girl next door.

The base definition of obnoxious is simply this: "extremely unpleasant."

So yes, that does fit. I've played many rpgs, mmo and otherwise, and most if not all of the major MOBAs. There is a reason that AoE DOTS are extremely limited in their nature and effects. They pose a lose-lose scenario for the opponent, to either be zoned away from their actions, or to take damage that becomes hard to escape from while also being hard to detect. People notice giant fireballs headed their way, and the chunk it takes out of your health. It's much much harder to detect and respond to the pool of poison by your feet.  One of the best example I've seen is DoTA 2's Venomancer. He has two AOE DoT abilities, one with a slow, and his ultimate that is one of the most damaging in the game. However, the damage of the slowing one is extremely weak, to where regeneration can almost mitigate it at early levels. And the ultimate literally has the condition of being unable to kill anything by itself. 

More to the point, it's a hard balance to strike. Do I think Cass needs some more work done? Absolutely. Do I think she's unhealthy? Yup, her playstyle is too "39 minutes useless" -> "40 minutes streamroller". But I also firmly and completely believe that her old playstyle of fire and forget had no place either.

And finally,
>  Btw do you know what Obnoxious means? Or you just throw it here cause you heard it alot of times on boards whenever someone tried to devalue others arguments/opinions?

I GUARANTEE I have more boards/forum experience than you and many others. Not everyone likes to stand out like Laughing Fish.

> Honestly? That was part of the problem. You can't have a strong AoE DOT. That's just obnoxious. Makes it even worse when it has bonus effects attached to it.

Meanwhile, Malzahar has the strongest AoE DoT in the game:

Null Zone: Malzahar creates a zone of negative energy for 5 seconds, dealing magic damage every second to all enemies standing on it, capped at 120 against minions and monsters.

「 MAGIC DAMAGE PER SECOND: 4 / 5 / 6 / 7 / 8% (+ 1% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health 」

and to name a few other strong AOE DoTs:

Anivia's Glacial Storm, Amumu's Despair, Brand's Blaze, Rumble's Flamespitter, Rumble's The Equalizer, Darius's Hemorrhage, Fiddlesticks Crowstorm, Garen Judgement, Heimerdinger's H-28G Evolution Turrets, Heimerdinger's UPGRADE!!!-d H-28G Evolution Turret, Karthus's Defile, Katarina's Death Lotus, Kayle's Righteous Fury, Morgana's Tormented Soil, Nasus's Spirit Fire, Pantheon's Heartseeker Strike, Rammus's Tremors, Singed's Poison Trail, Swain's Ravenous Flock, Teemo's Noxious Traps, Vel'Koz's Life Form Disintegration Ray, Viktor's Chaos Storm, Vladimir's Sanguine Pool, Volibear's Thunder Claws, Wukong's Cyclone, Yorick's entire kit, Zyra's plants.

Some of those aren't even AOE DOT's but even if they were, there's still a significant difference. Cass's q is very hard to dodge and does the full DOT damage to you if you get hit by it at all but nearly every example you gave stops damaging you the moment you move out of the AOE. Malzahar has the strongest AOE DoT in the game but the only way it actually does meaningful damage to you is if you get CC'ed while standing on it. Old Cass's nonstop Q harass was dumb as hell although the machine gun E was have now is hardly better.
She's always had the machine gun E on top of the Q spam, though pre-rework, landing the Q was pure luck since the explosion delay was anywhere between .3s and .7s.

Do note that most of those aren't DoTs. A DoT, in the classic game sense, is essentially 'One spell, multiple ticks of damage." In this case, it means being hit by a DoT means you get hit by ALL the damage. Once it hits you, you can't dodge the rest of the damage. Brand's Blaze is the best example. Everything else is damage per second, which is different. If you move out of Death Lotus or Chaos Storm, it will stop damaging you. Once you're hit by Cass's Q or W, however, you will take the full damage of it regardless of your actions, baring going invulnerable. Note that for Cass's W, by the way, the duration is 2 seconds of DoT, which is refreshed if you stay in the cloud. 

But to reiterate the point, other than Blaze, Noxious Traps, and Poison Trail, nothing you've mentioned is a DoT. Hell, I'm not even sure why you think Thunder Claws, Evolution turrets, or Zyra's plants are DoTs.

Edit: See, if basic LOGIC like this is getting downvoted, then how do you expect Riot to listen to you guys at all? Kinda feels like Morde isn't getting any help at this rate.

No, you never used W or Q for damage pre-rework. You mashed your face on E. You always mashed your face your E. There was never a time you didn't mash your face on E. Her old passive told you mash your face on E ffs. lol.

That was the whole point of me playing Cassiopeia. I know this isn't PRO-like, but who cares? I had lots of fun using only Q & W!
I didn't spam E's.. It wasn't fun for me at all. To the point where I'd use E maybe few times trough whole game. And FYI even though i didn't use E i still won lots of games with Cassio. Don't give me that "low elo/noob-tier" arguments. Both sides had fun and that was all that was important. 

Now you might see why I'm so annoyed with this rework.. They have destroyed my playstyle. Totally.

IF all you did was press Q and W and run away, then no, you shouldn't be annoyed. That playstyle was exactly the toxic playstyle that needed to be removed. It had about a 900 range of toss and forget without repercussion if you missed and had a huge reward if you hit while being a 4s CD without CDR. It was a low risk and high reward. Well, it was more like 0 risk for half lifing people. It was far more spammable than the old Nidalee spear and did just as much with about the same amount safety and frequency of hitting.

But have in mind that any hard engage on me meant pretty much free kill for enemy.

There are lots of different kinds of players and as many playstyles. You cannot remove 1 just because you believe it's "against" fun. Riot could have nerfed Cass range. Wouldn't that be a good fix? Allowing her to posion while creating risk of doesng so?

It's like saying [this is just EXTREME example] "all black people have to die, because they aren't white like me". You shouldn't force players to follow exactly 1 path and call it diversity.

As I mentioned before While playing posion-Cassiopeia I was very fragile to hard engages. Posion-Cass has little to no power to fight ina long battle. And I was always losing against "balls of steel" enemies. Don't you think that's pretty good balance?

Hit'n'run cassio (me) wins vs passive players
passive players win vs aggresive players
aggresive players win vs me

It's full circle and just so happens there are by far more passive players in silver than aggresive ones. Other way around my whole poison-build would be pointless, as I'd always lose.

That's... That's not how that works. You can still beat aggressive players since no matter what you build to make Poison Cass hurt, you still were able to spam E since after her rework, her E's cost was INCREASED and the damage is the exact same as it was before. Literally, Cass's rework made her passive useful and reduced the damage her poisons did. That's... That's it. And it was more of a ratio change than bases. W was reduced since in a prolonged team fight, having anyone stand in it at all meant certain death and her Q had an 80% ratio and 280ish base on top of a .5s CD .55 ratio E. 

Old Cass had one downside at it was a downside that made her near pointless to play and that was reliability. Champions who have 0 reliability are never played. Katarina is a good example. When she's at her prime, she's destroying teams, but put in a CC or two that's easy to land and Kat loses reliability and is now worthless. Same goes for Yasuo in a certain way. No knock ups and his reliability is subpar and he can't keep up, but you give him the reliable knock up and his power is through the roof. Cass got her reliability in the form of a new passive and her Q getting a more static delay rate, allowing her to be able to hit the targets often and go in for the kill. They removed her kill potential on her Fishing Tool so to speak. She's a snake. A Snake Mage. Snakes wait for the right time then go in for the kill, they don't spit poison, walk away, spit some more, walk away, spit more, walk away... No. The spitting Cobra spits and then goes for the kill and Cass is a prime example of such a snake. 

Cass works on aggressive players just like she always has since if they jump at her, she pops Archangel's and R and rips people apart. Before, she'd R, toss her Q and W and walk away without even thinking about it. No thoughts at all. There was no real counterplay since QSS didn't have a 2s Cd like her Q did. Her new kit has weaknesses and takes time to ramp up to her real power rather than throwing a Q at any point in the game and watching the enemy's health go from 100 to 0 without putting forth any kind of effort let alone using any mana.

Cassiopeia is one of my most played champions since her release, I absolutely love her, but she's considerably weaker than she was before her rework. So much of the damage from her kit was frontloaded onto her Twin Fang (E) that it made her other abilities, Miasma and Noxious Blast, accessories to Twin Fang. She used to be very effective at zoning and poking and then suddenly she became a mid-range mage with no mobility. That in the current meta and the way the game has evolve is very bad. 

The reason why she was picked so much in the spring split is because her base damage was good enough that it made her weak early game survivable. Her late game is fantastic, no doubt about that, but now that she's so easy to punish and she has so many inherent weaknesses, she really falls off as a strong champion

Let's take a look at her rework: primary reason, according to Riot, was that she was too much of a lane bully. So they turned her into an E bot with a stupid gimmick that no one really liked, and a really weak one at that. So naturally, instead of admitting that they made a mistake and actually trying to fix her, they simply buffed the shit out of her and soon had to nerf her - _because she was too much of a lane bully_. Which brings us to the same problem she and Morde share - a rework that does not solve champion's problems or create bigger ones is **entirely pointless**.

Yes, there will. Morde will be infinitely more healthy as a bot laner than he could ever be as a solo laner if Riot insists on keeping his no CC, no gap closer kit. Solo lane Morde was nothing more than a stat check. Morde either won or lost the 1v1 with no room to outplay mechanically from either side because his kit is so underloaded and braindead. Clearly new Morde is overtuned atm and some of his design concepts may need to change but the idea of Morde as a bot lane carry and not a solo laner is infinitely better and gives infinitely more room to balance that his solo laning days ever did.
